newsitem.title: UK: RJB Mining, Texaco studying UK power plant.
newsitem.headline: RJB Mining, Texaco studying UK power plant.

text.p: Britain's RJB Mining Plc said on Wednesday it was working with Texaco Inc on a joint study to explore the feasibility of developing a 400 megawatt "clean coal" power plant in northern England.
RJB said the plant would be developed on a site adjacent to its Kellingley Colliery in West Yorkshire.

Yorkshire-based RJB, the successor of British Coal in England and Wales, said the station would consume about one million tonnes of coal a year -- half the planned output of the Kellingley mine, which employs 700 people.
"This is an exciting opportunity offering the first commercial-scale development of clean coal technology in the UK," RJB said in a statement.
The company said it planned to begin talks with local authorities and other parties to make sure the new power station would meet planning requirements.
The plant would take about two years to build once planning consents were secured, RJB said.
